activities.name: Orthodox Easter Celebrations (Megali Evdomada & Pascha)
activities.description: Experience Greece's most significant religious holiday in Crete. Witness Holy Week processions (Epitaphios on Good Friday from churches like Agios Minas Cathedral or Agios Titos), the Anastasi midnight service on Holy Saturday with fireworks and joyous celebrations, followed by traditional lamb feasting on Easter Sunday (Pascha).
activities.seasonal_notes: A major event deeply rooted in Cretan tradition. Dates differ from Western Easter. Many shops may close for several days around Easter Sunday.
activities.booking_tips: Book accommodation and ferries/flights well in advance. Experience local traditions like cracking red eggs and eating lamb on the spit. Check restaurant availability for Easter Sunday.

activities.name: Explore Knossos & Archaeological Sites
activities.description: Visit the Palace of Knossos and other sites like Phaistos or Malia in comfortable spring weather before the summer heat and peak crowds arrive. Explore the Heraklion Archaeological Museum with its Minoan treasures.
activities.price_range: Moderate (Entry fees apply, consider combo tickets)
activities.seasonal_notes: Ideal temperatures for exploring large, exposed archaeological sites. Wildflowers often bloom around the sites, adding to the beauty.
activities.booking_tips: Buy Knossos/Museum combo ticket online to save time. Wear comfortable shoes and bring water. Consider hiring a guide for Knossos for better understanding.

activities.name: Hiking Gorges & Nature Trails
activities.description: Hike Crete's stunning gorges as they open for the season (Samaria usually opens May 1st, others like Agiofarago or Rouvas near Heraklion may be accessible earlier). Enjoy the lush spring vegetation and flowing streams.
activities.seasonal_notes: Spring offers cooler hiking conditions and greener landscapes than summer. Check specific gorge opening dates and conditions.
activities.booking_tips: Wear proper hiking boots. Check transport options (KTEL buses, tours, car rental). Assess difficulty level before choosing a gorge. Bring water and snacks.

activities.name: Enjoy Outdoor Cafes & Harbour Strolls
activities.description: Relax at cafes in Lions Square (Plateia Venizelou) or Plateia Eleftherias, or stroll along the Venetian Harbour promenade, enjoying Greek coffee, local pastries (bougatsa, kalitsounia), and the pleasant spring air.
activities.seasonal_notes: Perfect weather to embrace Heraklion's outdoor cafe culture and enjoy walks by the sea before the intense summer sun.
activities.booking_tips: Plenty of choices in the city center and along the waterfront. Explore side streets for potentially quieter spots.

activities.name: Wildflower Viewing in the Countryside
activities.description: Rent a car and drive through the Cretan countryside near Heraklion (e.g., towards Archanes or Peza) to see the island burst into color with abundant wildflowers, including orchids and poppies.
activities.seasonal_notes: Crete's landscape is particularly vibrant and green during spring after the winter rains.
activities.booking_tips: Combine with visits to villages, wineries, or archaeological sites. Stop frequently to enjoy the scenery.

activities.name: Beach Visits Near Heraklion
activities.description: Cool off at beaches easily accessible from Heraklion, such as the long sandy stretch of Amoudara (west), Karteros/Amnissos (east), or the popular bays of Agia Pelagia (west). Enjoy swimming, sunbathing, and beachside tavernas.
activities.seasonal_notes: Peak beach season with warm sea temperatures. Beaches can get crowded, especially on weekends.
activities.booking_tips: Accessible by local bus or car. Amoudara is the closest large beach. Agia Pelagia offers more sheltered coves.

activities.name: Ferry Trips to Cycladic Islands
activities.description: Take advantage of frequent summer ferry connections from Heraklion Port for day trips or longer stays on islands like Santorini (fastest/most popular), Mykonos, Paros, or Naxos.
activities.seasonal_notes: High season for ferry travel; routes are most frequent. High-speed ferries offer quicker trips but are more expensive.
activities.booking_tips: Book ferry tickets well in advance, especially for popular routes like Santorini or for vehicle transport. Check schedules on sites like Ferryhopper or directly with ferry companies (SeaJets, Minoan, Golden Star etc.).

activities.name: Heraklion Summer Arts Festival
activities.description: Attend concerts, theatre performances, dance shows, and art exhibitions held at various venues across the city, including open-air theatres like Nikos Kazantzakis Garden Theatre or Technopolis.
activities.seasonal_notes: Heraklion hosts a diverse cultural program during the summer months.
activities.booking_tips: Check the Municipality of Heraklion's cultural program (usually released late spring/early summer) for schedules and ticket information.

activities.name: Evening 'Volta' & Waterfront Dining
activities.description: Join the locals for the evening stroll ('volta') along the harbour or through the city center streets. Enjoy dinner at seaside tavernas near the Koules Fortress or lively restaurants in the Old Town.
activities.seasonal_notes: Cooler evening temperatures make it the perfect time for outdoor dining and socializing.
activities.booking_tips: Waterfront tavernas offer great views. Restaurants in the city center alleys can have a very lively atmosphere. Reservations recommended for popular spots.

activities.name: Museum Visits (Air-Conditioned Escape)
activities.description: Escape the midday summer heat by visiting Heraklion's excellent air-conditioned museums, such as the Archaeological Museum, Historical Museum of Crete, or the Natural History Museum.
activities.seasonal_notes: Museums provide a cool and culturally enriching alternative to outdoor activities during peak heat hours.
activities.booking_tips: Check opening hours. The Archaeological Museum is a must-see; allow ample time.

activities.name: Wine Tasting in Peza Region
activities.description: Visit wineries in the Peza wine region, just south of Heraklion, during or after the grape harvest. Sample indigenous Cretan grape varieties like Vidiano, Vilana, Kotsifali, and Mandilari.
activities.seasonal_notes: Harvest season (late Aug/Sept) is a busy but interesting time. Wineries are generally open for tastings throughout autumn.
activities.booking_tips: Book winery visits and tastings in advance, especially for smaller producers. Consider a guided wine tour or rent a car. Several well-known wineries are located near Peza village.

activities.name: Raki Distillation ('Kazania') Experience
activities.description: Witness the traditional distillation of 'tsikoudia' (Cretan raki) at a 'kazani' (distillery) in villages surrounding Heraklion. This is a highly social event often involving feasting, music, and fresh raki tasting.
activities.price_range: Varies (Often requires local connection or organized tour)
activities.seasonal_notes: A unique Cretan tradition following the grape harvest. The smell of distilling grapes fills the villages.
activities.booking_tips: Access often requires knowing locals or joining a specific cultural tour focusing on Kazania. Check with local tour operators or information centers for possibilities.

activities.name: Explore Archaeological Sites Comfortably
activities.description: Revisit Knossos or explore other sites like Gortyna (ancient Roman capital of Crete) with fewer crowds and pleasant autumn temperatures.
activities.seasonal_notes: Ideal weather for extensive site exploration. Olive harvest may be starting in surrounding areas later in autumn.
activities.booking_tips: Combine visits to sites like Gortyna with exploration of the Messara plain.

activities.name: Olive Oil Press Visits & Tasting
activities.description: As the olive harvest begins (typically late autumn), visit a modern olive oil press ('eleotriveio') near Heraklion to learn about extra virgin olive oil production and taste fresh, pungent 'agourelaio' (early harvest oil).
activities.seasonal_notes: Olive harvest is a crucial part of Cretan life and economy. Seeing the process offers great insight.
activities.booking_tips: Arrange visits in advance, either directly with presses that offer tours or through specialized agricultural tourism operators.

activities.name: Enjoy Cozy Tavernas & Mezedopoleia
activities.description: As evenings cool, enjoy the warmth and traditional flavors of Heraklion's tavernas and mezedopoleia, sampling heartier seasonal dishes and local wine or raki.
activities.seasonal_notes: Perfect time for enjoying indoor dining and the social atmosphere of shared mezedes.
activities.booking_tips: Explore alleys in the city center or ask locals for recommendations for authentic spots.

activities.name: Museum Exploration Season
activities.description: Dedicate time to explore Heraklion's museums in depth without summer crowds: Archaeological Museum, Historical Museum of Crete, Natural History Museum, Museum of Christian Art.
activities.seasonal_notes: Low tourist season provides a relaxed museum-visiting experience. Ideal for rainy or cooler days.
activities.booking_tips: Check winter opening hours, which may be shorter than in summer.

activities.name: Cozy Tavernas & Rakadika
activities.description: Experience the authentic winter atmosphere in traditional tavernas and 'rakadika' (places serving raki and mezedes). Enjoy hearty Cretan winter dishes, local wine, and the warm hospitality.
activities.seasonal_notes: Winter is prime time for enjoying indoor dining and the lively, social atmosphere of rakadika, especially in areas like Lakkos or Kourkoutis.
activities.booking_tips: Seek out places popular with locals for the most authentic experience. Raki is often served with complimentary small bites.

activities.name: Apokries (Carnival) Celebrations
activities.description: Participate in or observe the Greek carnival season ('Apokries') festivities leading up to Lent (usually Feb/March). Enjoy costume parties, parades (check for local Heraklion events), and the traditional meat-eating day of Tsiknopempti ('Smoky Thursday').
activities.seasonal_notes: A fun, festive period before Lent. Dates vary based on Orthodox Easter.
activities.booking_tips: Book restaurants for Tsiknopempti far in advance. Check local listings for specific carnival events or parties in Heraklion.

activities.name: Christmas & New Year Atmosphere
activities.description: See Heraklion decorated for Christmas and New Year, particularly around Plateia Eleftherias (Liberty Square) and Lions Square. Enjoy festive lights, maybe a small Christmas market or ice rink (check annual events), and New Year's Eve celebrations.
activities.seasonal_notes: While Easter is bigger, Heraklion has a pleasant festive atmosphere. Emphasis is often on family gatherings.
activities.booking_tips: Check the Municipality's program for official events. Book NYE dinners/parties well ahead.

activities.name: Enjoy Citrus Season
activities.description: Savor the abundance of fresh Cretan citrus fruits (oranges, mandarins, lemons) available at the Central Market and throughout the island. Enjoy fresh juice or incorporate them into meals.
activities.seasonal_notes: Winter is peak season for delicious Cretan citrus.
activities.booking_tips: Buy directly from the market for the freshest selection and best prices.
